item.title: Report X-2023110453
item.description:
Report X-2023110453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE SOUTH SORT AISLE. RESPONDER NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE CORNERS OF THE OUTER PACKAGING. DONED HIS P.P.E. HE THEN, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUBE. THE AREA WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. HE THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESS.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: SOMERVILLE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING CLINICAL NUTRITION VIAL SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX HAS PERISHABLE, THIS SIDE UP, AND RUSH PREPRINTED ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8767X8, SENSORY CLOUD, INC., 50 MILK ST., BOSTON MA 02110.

item.title: Report X-2023110410
item.description:
Report X-2023110410

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES WERE NOTICED TO HAVE HEAVY FROST FORMING ON THEM. THE BOXES ALSO HAD HANDWRITTEN MARKINGS INDICATING CONTENTS INSIDE WERE PERISHABLE, FRAGILE, THIS SIDE UP, AND HANDLE WITH CARE. UPON INSPECTION FOUND APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD IN EACH PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED TO COOL THE PERISHABLE CONTENTS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZA75171307938937. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A75Y17, VNDR, 2323 BROADWAY, OAKLAND CA 94612.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND BY SMALLS TENDER AND REMOVED FROM THE BELT/SINGULATOR AND PLACED IT ON THE GRATING. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT TO THE PSC.   • Description: THE UNLOADER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. THE UNLOADER DID NOT INITIALLY NOTICE THE DAMAGE DUE TO THE DARKNESS INSIDE OF THE TRAILER. EMPLOYEE MOVED THE PACKAGE TO THE UNLOAD ROLLERS, WHERE HE THEN SAW THAT THE PACKAGE WAS PUNCTURED AND LEAKING SMALL AMOUNTS OF LIQUID. FOLLOWING PROCEDURES, HE SET IT DOWN AND NOTIFIED MANAGEMENT WHO CALLED FOR A RESPONDER. THERE WAS NO RESIDUE ON THE GROUND OR ON ANY OTHER SURFACE FOR THE RESPONDER TO ABSORB, SO THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAINERIZED AND MOVED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023110361
item.description:
Report X-2023110361

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED/DISTREESED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOUR ODOR BY A PRIMARY SORTER IN SECTION-B. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE VENT/AUXILARY CAP ON A 5-GAL CLOSED HEAD POLY PAIL WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 48 LBS/SQ IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023110360
item.description:
Report X-2023110360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES. THE RESPONDER DONNED THE PROPER PPE AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE COULD BE TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE INNER CONTAINERS EACH HAD LOOSE CAPS BY 1/4 TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES HAD LEAKED FROM 3 OF THE FOUR GALLON JUGS. THERE WAS A FIBERBOARD PARTITION SURROUNDING THE UPPER SECION OF THE BOTTLES AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALLED FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/6/2023 at approximately 1202, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 154002 at the station location in Temecula, reporting a package spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing two plastic cans overpacked into another fiberboard box. One of the plastic containers spilled due to a loose cap. Further inspecttion revealed that the inner fiberboard was labeled with Class 8 hazard label. An online safety data sheet futher classified the shipment as UN 2491. The outer package was not marked and labeled per IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were closed tightly and placed into salvage drum upright to stop any further leakage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPRR employee reported a strong odor emitting from bowl track 40, Roseville Yard, with LPG tank cars. TILX 300895 was found with an odor coming from the protective housings. TILX 300895: ?B end? Liquid Valve was partially open; the plug was less then tool tight and did not create a seal. 1 liquid cup of LPG released from the plug threads. Closing the valve stopped the release. The plug threads were cleaned, new Teflon was applied, and the plug was secured to the valve. Old Seal 00048873, New Seal 0000284.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing approximately 295-gallons of Ethyl Thioglycolate (UN2810) was crushed and punctured as a result of improper loading. This resulted in 4-gallons of product spilling onto the trailer floor and the asphalt below. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. The damaged tote was cut-up and containerized into two UN-rated shipping containers for disposal. No storm drains, water ways, or soil were impacted by the release.

  • Description: On November 21, 2023, at 1950 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of NOX-RUST 7703-W (UN1268 PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., (Naphtha Solvent), Combustible liquid, PG III) from (1) 55-gallon DM. It was reported the release was contained to an area of concrete only. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that facility personnel cleaned the spill and overpacked the damaged container. All waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Description: On November 22, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Chesterfield, Michigan regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of UN1263 PAINT 3, III from (1) IBC tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Contractors were able to clean the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55- Gallon DM which was then staged on-site by the contractor in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of material released to the packaging/container only. The cap of one 1-gallon poly jug was crushed causing a release. The damaged jug was removed from the box and containerized along with PPE into a 15-gallon poly jug. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: MONROE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallond drum containing UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sulfuric acid solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and excess debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 fell off the lift gate and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN2810-impacted trailer and roadway. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and taken to the R+L terminal for disposal.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023110934
item.description:
Report X-2023110934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on van line on 11/10 appearing mostly undamaged but with small paint leak or smear on top closure. Package was isolated from sort by line manager for inspection by QA. As box is an undeclared hazmat with no markings on box, it was placed in black non-hazmat bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection. QA was unable to inspect package on 11/10 and held box for inspection overnight. On 11/11, package was inspected and discovered to be an undeclared hazmat. Package was then placed in a red hazmat bin with hazmat liner. DescribePack: Outer package appears undamaged, with no punctures or tears on box, but with a small amount of paint leaking from edge of top closure. Leak almost fully contained inside package. Package contains 2 paint cans; 1 can has been dented, pushing lid up and allowing leak. Other can appears undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leak contained almost fully inside box and did not affect other packages. Box was first placed in a plain black bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection; when package was discovered to be an undeclared hazmat, it was moved into a red hazmat bin with hazmat bag liner.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arriving to the QA cage, a hazmat was found leaking. Package was brought into the hazmat cage for inspection. During inspection it was found one jug had a loose vented cap that was the cause of the leakage. After inspection was finished jugs and outer package were placed into a salvage drum to prevent further leakage. DescribePack: Failure was caused by one vented cap leaking from one of the jugs. cap was tightened back to the jug and placed into a drum to prevent further leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further vaper and leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023110580
item.description:
Report E-2023110580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 16, 2023, five (5) 3-gallon pails of UN3267 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to the spill and swept them in with hand tools. Crews used absorbent pads and a degreasing solution to wipe down the impacted freight and trailer floor, and then they restacked and repackaged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. All neutralized product, absorbent pads, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: On November 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetone was dented by an operator and released approximately fifteen (15) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbents to the acetone impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023110507

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced a NA1760 Aluma-Brite HD release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of material released to a 5 x 5 and 10 x 3 areas of the trailer floor and a 10 x 3 area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110504

  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing (UN3265) DEPOSITROL BL5600 was punctured by a pallet likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 100-gallons of product released onto the dock, the trailer floor, and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. No storm drains, waster ways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report E-2023110495
item.description:
Report E-2023110495

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: UPPER SANDUSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3066 Sika Floor 161-264 Part B release from a 1-gallon metal can. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of material released to a 15 x 8 area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail was containerized into a double lined 55-gallon metal drum. Soda ash and absorbents were then deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallet pieces were then containerized into a second double lined 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, DURING X-RAY PROCESS ONE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CAN OF LYSOL WAS FOUND AMONG VARIOUS OTHER ITEMS NOT REGULATED AS DANGEROUS GOODS. THIS PACKAGE IS PART OF A LARGER MULTIPLE OF TWENTY PACKAGES WHICH APPEAR TO BE ITEMS SHIPPING FOR RELOCATION PURPOSES. INVOICE AND THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTION IS FURNITURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM FLORIDA USING UPS ACCOUNT CE5036, SALIM LYAZIDI, 7512 DR PHILLIPS BLVD, ORLANDO FL 32819.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE IS NOTICEABLY WET AND STAINED, DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS INSIDE CONTAINED 2 X 5 LITERS OF CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZING LIQUIDS. PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO LOOSEN BOTTLE CAPS CAUSING LIQUIDS TO LEAKAGE AND DAMAGE PACKAGE ENTIRELY. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

HCE personnel utilized oil dry and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent oil dry and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the two (2) damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

It is likely that the tote was not adequately prepared and/or secured for transport. A contractor neutralized that release and cleaned-up the trailer floor. The remaining contents of the tote were transferred into a new, intact tote. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

The damaged 1-gallon plastic jug along with three (3) impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

  • City: OSHKOSH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on QA rollers at beginning of AM sort with an inspection required scan (usual process and placement of pkg for us). Sr QA Admin inspected pkg, cutting it open and pulling out all 4 cans; no evidence of leakage but all 4 cans were dented. Pkg put back into sort. Wet bottom on pkg found on 200 belt and was sent to QA. When starting to complete HESS, QA found the UN # on OP-900 did not match the UN # on the cans. Paperwork shows UN1133 (adhesive); can labels show UN1123 (a thinner) which is consistent with the odor of the leakage. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 cans were heavily dented along the bottom seams. Both had pinhole leaks on the bottom. No punctures visible on bottom of shipping box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg place in plastic tote. QA person opened box and turned the 2 leaking cans upside down to stop the seepage.

  • Description: It was reported a 25-gallon release of Methyl Chloroform-343 (UN2831) from a 55-gallon metal drum. The product is regulated as a UN2831, 1,1,1 Trichloroethena, 6.1, III. Because of the toxic hazardous properties of the material, ERTS advised they would be sending a contractor to assist with this spill. One of the drums of the product was punctured by a forklift during unloading by the LSL terminal, causing the release to impact the trailer interior, pallet, and dock. The drum was tipped onto its side to prevent further spilling and absorbents were deployed onto the spilled area. The terminal uprighted the drum and deployed absorbents. Upon contractor arrival it was estimated 1Gal was released in a 4'x4' area. 1-85 gallon DM / contains overpacked drum, impacted absorbentsand 1-55 gallon DM / contains impacted absorbents, PPE were left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: On November 15, 2023 at 2041 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallons of Inferno (UN1824, Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) plastic- IBC tote that cracked due to a load shift releasing product onto the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The remaining product in the damaged tote was then transferred into a new plastic IBC tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: ST JAMES
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 AM a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Caustic Soda to a customer site (Mosaic) located in St. James, LA. The driver met with the customer site operator, completed the In the Interest of Safety Form (which is a form utilized by Basic Chemical truck drivers to ensure that enough space exists in a customer tank prior to unloading), hooked up offloading hoses, and began offloading. Near the end of offloading, the driver knew the tanker trailer was getting close to being empty, so he got with the customer site operator to check the level of the storage tank again to ensure there was enough room remaining in the product storage tank. The operator checked the level of the storage tank and confirmed with the driver that there was enough space to complete the offload. Not long after the customer site operator left the area the storage tank began to overflow and the Basic Chemicals truck driver immediately shut down the flow of product. The driver got with the customer site operator to notify him of the overflow and the operator stated that the tank level indicator had been malfunctioning lately. Customer site personnel were able to clean up the spill which was estimated to be approximately 20 gallons. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN2735 ACTech 2170 FC Part B release from a 2.4-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of Part B released to a 1 x 1 area of the cardboard on the trailer floor due to being crushed. A second pail containing Part A was also damaged, releasing approximately 0.25-gallons. Spill pads were utilized to wipe up the released product. The damaged pails and impacted rags were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110254
item.description:
Report E-2023110254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: PRAIRIE GROVE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 on Friday, November 3, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Hydrochloric Acid to a customer site (AZZ Inc.) located in Prairie Grove, AR. When the driver began to offload product they immediately noticed the cam-lock connection at the customers connection was dripping, so they shut down the process, cleared the line and shimmed the cam-lock ears. The driver resumed unloading a second time and noticed the fitting continued to drip so they closed the internal valve on top of the tanker trailer and replaced the gasket at the cam-lock connection. When the driver reopened the internal valve, product was released from the CPVC piping system that is connected to the internal valve of the trailer. Approximately 2 cups of product was release and spilled. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

item.title: Report E-2023110238
item.description:
Report E-2023110238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 07, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of UN1866 Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, III from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the side of the drum only. Contractors inspected the trailer and confirmed there was no evidence of a release onto the trailer floor but found 2 additional damaged drums that were not leaking. The impacted drum was wiped clean, and the 3 damaged drums were transferred into a metal overpack without complication. The overpacks and the rest of the cargo were secured for transport and forwarded on to the original consignee. Contractors did not collect any waste during this ER response.

item.title: Report E-2023110236
item.description:
Report E-2023110236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1866 P077-310 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of material released to a 20 x 8 area of the trailer floor, a 20 x 15 area of the concrete dock floor and a 12 x 8 area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a puncture caused by impact with other freight. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were containerized into (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110332
item.description:
Report E-2023110332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: Brewster
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1100 hrs. on 10-23-2023, the WLE Brewster Yardmaster called myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. He told me the Brewster Yard Car Inspectors could smell an odor from tank car CPDX 111023. I came out to look at the car and used a gas detection meter on the protective house and confirmed that this car was leaking. I removed cable seal #1756092 and opened the protective housing to find that the A end liquid valve was frosted over and leaking. I checked the valve handle to find that it was loose. The valve was leaking through the valve plug threads. I tightened the valve and the leak stopped. It took about an 1/8 of a turn to stop the leak. I then tightened the valve plug. I reinstalled cable seal 0000235 on the protective housing and then released the car for service.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/19/2023 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 679706 at the station location in South Beach, reporting an undeclared aerosol shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 boxes of floral arrangements, one of which had an aerosol can of paint inside that was clearly seen through the hand holes. The offending shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required marking, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The other two packages contained non-dg commodity. The package is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023110516
item.description:
Report E-2023110516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: MERCURY
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 3
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DRIVER WAS TRAVELING FROM AZ TO BEATTY NEVADA TO OFFLOAD THE TANKER WHEN HE OBSERVED IT OFF GASSING. HE TRIED TO RELIEVE THE PRESURE BUT WASN'T ABLE TO. THE TANKER EXPLODED WHICH RESULTED IN A RELEASE OF 4,000G OF UN2014- 31% HYDROGREN PEROXIDE. INTERCOMPANY EMERGENCY RESPONSE ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL BY DIGGING UP THE CONTAMINATED SOIL AND PUTTING THE MATERIAL INTO DRUMS AND BINS WITHIN 24 HOURS. THE STATE AND NRC WERE NOTIFIED IMMEDIATELY. THE FREEWAY WAS SHUT DOWN. FIRE DEPARTMENT AND STATE PATROL RESPONDED. NEVADA HIGHWAY PATROL ISSUED OUT VIOLATIONS FOR USING THE WRONG TANKER FOR THE MATERIAL TRANSPORTED AND FOR NOT HAVING THE SPECIAL PERMIT ON TH PROPER SHIPPING NAME.

  • Description: Our driver left his lane of travel, overcorrected and caused the truck and trailer to overturn on the shoulder causing damage to the tank and trailer resulting in a fuel release. Fire Dept. and police arrived on scene. They called in EnviroCare to clean up the spill. Most of the spill ended up on Union Pacific Railroad property, so railroad called in their own cleanup crew and they are still on site hauling soiled material away as of 10/27/23. We do not know the extent of the property loss right now to give a dollar amount.

item.title: Report E-2023100694
item.description:
Report E-2023100694

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/23/2023, at 1409 hours, personnel in the CSXT Boyles Yard in Birmingham, AL, reported GATX 60281, a loaded tank car of Molten Sulfur, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, HF Sinclair, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2023-10-23-00150). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a vapor release coming from the manway of the rail car. Contractor personnel determined that 6 of the 6 manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative: Mike Ernst (214-871-3590). Contractor personnel properly secured the manway swing bolts using a 24 wrench; this stopped all product vapor from leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023110002
item.description:
Report X-2023110002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/13/2023 at approximately 1945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5608001 at the station location in St. Louis, reporting an undeclared corrosive spill. The shipment consists of 8 fiberboard boxes. 1 fiberboard box was observed damaged due to wetness. Further investigation revealed there were two boxes inside marked with "UN 3265, Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic n.o.s. (Urea Sulfate)" and labeled with Class 8 hazard label. Eack of the inner boxes contained 4 plastic containers, identified as "multi-purpose degreaser". The outer package was not prepared per IATA Regulations. It is undetermined if the 7 other mps shipments were identical since they moved forward in transport before the discovery. The damaged package is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023101242
item.description:
Report X-2023101242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-15
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10-15-2023 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap during routing work operations at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, IA. The employee notified the Yard Supervisor who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The BOV handle was cycled several times from the closed to open position to ensure there was no foreign material trapped in the valve seat that would prevent a proper seal. The cap was then removed and the valve was monitored for 10 minutes for any continued leakage. There was no longer any leakage from the valve at this point. An inspection of the BOV cap gasket was performed and revealed it to be very stiff allowing the product to leak past the gasket. The BOV gasket was replaced and the cap re-installed utilizing a 24" pipe wrench. Car was released back to CN transportation department for continued transportation to destination.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-15
  • City: Lake Zurich
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: We conducted a test purchase of Ten Aces Medical Adhesive; a flammable aerosol product. As we suspected, the bottle was improperly packaged and it was not marked as a hazardous shipment. The bottle was shipped via USPS Ground Advantage(9400 1082 0549 9385 6823 17) Shipper did not use a strong outer box; it was shipped in a bubble mailer. Shipper did not use Limited Quantity labels. Shiper did not use Orientation labels. Shipper did not use a plastic bag and absorbant material(USPS requirement). Shipper did not declare the parcel contains a hazardous item(USPS requirement) Note that Ten Aces Medical also ships larger quantities, and international air shipments. We are concerned because Ten Aces Medical appears to operate with a general disregard for DOT regulations, FDA

UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE CONTENTS THERE IS ONE BOTTLE OF 3-METHYLINDOLE (SKATOLE), >99% ACS GRADE, CAS: 83-34-1. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS CHEMICALS. ONE BOTTLE IS IODOMETHANE, CAS: 74-88-4 REGULATED AS UN2644, METHYL IODIDE, 6.1, PG I. ONE BOTTLE IS BROMOETHANE, CAS: 74-96-4 REGULATED AS UN1891, ETHYL BROMIDE, 3 (6.1),II. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605.

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: DFW AIRPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This passenger seated on 32H came to the back galley during the second break and told us one of his 3-4 batteries of his vape pen was hot and the wrapper around the battery is half way burnt. They were four flight attendants(#6.#8.#9) in the back galley including myself(#3) and we all smelled the burning odor. We took the battery from the passenger and pulled up standard procedures from manual, retrieved the fire containment bag from compartment 768, flowed the steps and sealed the bag and put it in a empty cart in compartment 972. Upon landing the bag was handed to the passenger and he gave it to people who met the flight. Captain was notified right away and everyone has been monitoring the situation. Management was meeting the flight.

  • Description: Driver was on store lot unloading compartment number 4 of our DOT tank trailer. Driver did not latch the fittings to the drop tube correctly. When the material started to flow it 'jumped' like normal and the hose disconnected from the drop tube resulting in a spill of diesel fuel of around 170 gallons. The driver stopped the flow of product and contacted the local fire department. York local fire department personnel, in house clean up, and 3rd party clean up teams all responded to the scene. We also filed a report with the Pennsylvania Dept. of Environmental Protection.

  • Description: On October 02, 2023, at 1147 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Hub Group personnel in Bloomington, California regarding the release of approximately (30) gallons of F-204, Liquid Alkaline Foam Cleaner and Degreaser UN3266 Corrosion Liquid, Basic, Inorganic, N.O.S., (Sodium Silicate), 8, III Cleaning Compound, 55 from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a 16' x 7' area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to clean the release without complication. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite by contractors in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Description: The spill consisted of (2) 275 gallon metal totes containing Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 (UN1993), which released from the top of both totes due to improper packaging on the totes. The terminal stated the lids on both totes were not sufficiently sealed properly, causing approximately 10 ounces combined to slosh out from both totes during transit. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spilled amount with Oil Dri and placed the contents into a 5 gallon poly drum. The terminal tightened the lids on both totes and moved them on to the consignee. The 5Gal poly drum of waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: It was reported a spill of regulated UN1133 "Tensorbond C307 Low VOC Sprayable Contact Adhesive" arrived damaged at Terminal XPB.   • Description: On 10/19/23 a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO was observed to be leaking. Upon investigation it was discovered that three 28-gallon plastic bins containing IV bags fell over while in transportation due to the shipment not being properly secured. After the containers fell, some of the IV Bags fell and ruptured due to weight and impact. Approximately 15 gallons released onto the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. Facility personnel conducted cleanup operations.

item.title: Report E-2023110269
item.description:
Report E-2023110269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Fremont, CA was moving two 55 gal drums to load onto a trailer with a forklift. The forklift had a double drum attachment which was used to pick up and move the drums. The employee raised the forklift but he failed to lift the drums high enough which resulted in one of the drum being smashed between the drum attachment stabilizing bar and the trailer floor frame. This resulted in one of the drums being crushed and causing a leak. Another employee got on the forklift and quickly brought the drums down to the ground and disengaged the drum grabber so that the drum could be tilted to the side to minimize the spill. Other Veolia employees quickly grabbed absorbent and contained the spill. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gal poly salvage drum and absorbent was used to cleaned the area. Pressure washer was used to decontaminated the affected area. The spilled occurred on asphalt and did not result in release to the environment.

item.title: Report E-2023110381
item.description:
Report E-2023110381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had loaded diesel into compartments 1,3 and 4, Driver states he put out cones and stuck tanks. Driver started unloading Compartment 4 into tank 5 and Compartment 1 into tank 4. Driver states that tank 5 had 81 in tank prior to dropping and tank 4 had 80. Compartment 4 Tank 5 drop completed, and the driver drained the hose and disconnected from truck but left the drop hooked up to ground connection. Driver was planning to move the hose and drop gun from compartment 4 tank 5 to compartment 3 tank 7. Driver checked the other hose and notice the well on tank 4 started to fill up. Driver shut down unloading from compartment 1. The manifold system between the tanks caused tank 5 to fill the well along with product to come back out of hose on the ground. Driver tried to cap the end of the hose that was still hooked up to tank 5 drop and was sprayed with diesel. Driver had to drop the rest of compartment 1 into tank 7. All the diesel tanks are Mani folded together.

  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Technically this spill was related to our driver fueling the tractor trailer fuel tank and not the actual trailer vessel. However, Driver bypassed safety feature on the fuel dispenser handle by putting something under it to hold it open. Came into the terminal while fueling and when he returned fuel had spilled from his tank into the gravel and traveled downhill to the tree line. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Estimated gallons of diesel fuel was 30 gallons. Again, this is from fueling the tractor and not related to the trailer vessel.
